Package co.cookies.sdk

Class CookiesSDKManager

  • java.lang.Object
    • co.cookies.sdk.ExtensibleCookiesSDK<SDKConfiguration>
      • co.cookies.sdk.CookiesSDKManager
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    SDKConfiguration, SDKServiceProvider, java.io.Closeable, java.lang.AutoCloseable
    @Immutable
@ThreadSafe
public abstract class CookiesSDKManager
extends ExtensibleCookiesSDK<SDKConfiguration>
implements SDKConfiguration, SDKServiceProvider
    Central manager for the Cookies SDK for Java; provides coordination via shared config and service support.

    The central SDK manager should be a long-lived object (potentially a singleton in some applications), which is used to acquire cached access to SDK service objects. Any services bound to a given CookiesSDKManager inherit various components, such as:

    • Execution: All bound services share an executor, potentially customized.
    • Credentials: All bound services shared authorization materials, including API keys.
    • Transport: Cached access to transport services, including pooled channeling.
    • Logging: Services spawn SLF4J loggers at their client class name by default.

    How to acquire an SDK manager

    Developers should use the CookiesSDK facade class to acquire this manager, specifically by using the builder methods on CookiesSDKManager.Builder. A new SDK builder object can be acquired with CookiesSDK.builder(). For example: var builder = CookiesSDK.builder() .setApiKey("your-api-key-here") .build(); // or, for public service access which requires no configuration... var sdk = CookiesSDK.builder().build();

    See Also:
    Facade factory

      • executorProvider

        @Nonnull
public com.google.api.gax.core.ExecutorProvider executorProvider()
        Returns an executor provider implementing execution services for the SDK.

        If a custom executor is set via the SDK settings, this will use that executor. If no explicit executor is set, the default executor generated for the SDK is returned by the provider.

        Specified by:
        executorProvider in interface SDKConfiguration
        Returns:
        Executor provider for SDK use.
        See Also:
        Custom executor services

      • transportChannelProvider

        @Nonnull
public com.google.api.gax.rpc.TransportChannelProvider transportChannelProvider()
        Returns a configured TransportChannelProvider which provides network transit to SDK services.

        Invoking users will generally want to leave this un-customized, instead opting to specify an executor or body of method settings. The default transport provider (InstantiatingGrpcChannelProvider) intelligently manages a pool of channels on top of the configured executor.

        Specified by:
        transportChannelProvider in interface SDKConfiguration
        Returns:
        Provider for transport channel instances.

      • credentialsProvider

        @Nonnull
public com.google.api.gax.core.CredentialsProvider credentialsProvider()
        Returns a configured CredentialsProvider which provides authorization to SDK services.

        By default, authorization is left empty by the SDK. If accessing a protected or otherwise authorized service, the developer must enclose credentials using this property. Providers exist for fixed credentials, OAuth2-based credentials, and more.

        Specified by:
        credentialsProvider in interface SDKConfiguration
        Returns:
        Credentials provider for SDK use.

      • headerProvider

        @Nonnull
public com.google.api.gax.rpc.HeaderProvider headerProvider()
        Returns a configured HeaderProvider which applies active SDK settings.

        API keys and credentials are automatically handled by the SDK with regard to headers, although a developer may elect to provide their own header provider as well. For custom header providers, the developer must account for all headers including API key or authorization headers.

        Specified by:
        headerProvider in interface SDKConfiguration
        Returns:
        Header provider for SDK use.

public SDKConfiguration getSettings()
